events.message: Customer reported a car accident involving their vehicle and another car at a busy intersection during morning rush hour.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after review of the initial report and basic details were confirmed.
An experienced claims agent was assigned to handle the customer's auto accident claim promptly and with priority.
Customer received official acknowledgment of the auto accident claim along with the claim reference number.
Request sent to customer for photos of vehicle damage, police report, and driver’s license to continue claim process.
Customer submitted all requested documents including detailed photos of the damaged auto and official police collision report.
Investigation began to assess the extent of damage and verify the circumstances surrounding the car accident claim.
Investigation report completed, confirming liability and estimating repair costs for the vehicle after the collision.
Proposed settlement offer communicated to the customer based on the damage assessment and repair cost estimates.
Customer responded positively to the settlement offer and expressed satisfaction with the communication and handling.
The auto accident claim was formally approved by the claims department after customer agreement on settlement.
Payment issued to the customer’s designated bank account covering the approved amount for damage repairs.
The auto accident claim was successfully closed after the customer confirmed receipt of funds and repair completion.
